text: today we're going to talk about
something that we try to avoid at all
costs failure we're taught from a young
age by our teachers parents and society
that failure is bad that it's something
that we should be ashamed of but the
truth is many of the most successful
people started out as failures and
eventually succeeded because of the
benefits that failure brought into their
lives so in today's video we'll go over
three ways that failure can ultimately
set you up for Success our first tip is
failure is feedback in 2019 researchers
from Northwestern University published a
study looking at what separates winners
from losers they collected millions of
data points and discovered that the
biggest predictor of success wasn't how
hard someone worked how persistent they
were or even how many times they failed
the biggest predictor of success was
whether or not they learned from their
failures you see failure as a form of
feedback when you fail it means that the
strategy that you implemented was flawed
somewhere along the way you made a
mistake miscalculation in these
situations it's crucial for you to
identify what this mistake could be so
you could try to avoid it the next time
around for example let's say you've been
trying to improve your social skills you
just had a conversation with an
acquaintance where things got heated
when the topic of politics came up and
after which they stopped talking to you
in this situation you quote unquote
failed but it's fine because at least
you got some feedback which forces you
to rethink about how the conversation
went after some reflection you might
realize that maybe you shouldn't have
gotten emotional when the conversation
shifted towards politics maybe you
shouldn't have labeled the other person
as X Y or Z maybe you should have
avoided the topic altogether or let the
other person speak and just listen these
are all things you can try out the next
time around over time as you fail over
and over again you will get better and
better at speaking to people as you
realize there are certain things you
should or shouldn't do without failing
over and over again you never get the
feedback needed to learn learn these
lessons tip number two is that failure
increases resilience a study was
conducted where researchers followed two
groups of factory workers who'd recently
been laid off one group had lost their
jobs three times before in the past
while the other group only lost their
job once before the researchers expected
the first group to be discouraged and
take longer to get back on their feet
but surprisingly they found that these
workers were more optimistic and found
new jobs more quickly than the workers
in the second group the study concluded
that the workers in the first group were
better equipped to deal with failure
because they had experienced it many
times before in other words they were
more resilient these workers had dealt
with failure enough times in their life
to know that it's an expected part of
life getting laid off yet again was not
as much as a surprise to them like it
might have been with the second group of
workers this gave them a more stoic
perspective which allowed them to
quickly focus on what they had to do in
order to find another job this mindset
is the epitome of resilience
psychologists argued that resilience is
important because it helps us keep our
cool when stressed adapt when
circumstances change and focus on
long-term goals all of which are crucial
for Success knowing that we've become
more resilient also gives us the
confidence needed to take more risks and
lean into challenges tip number three is
that failure increases creativity the
average entrepreneur has 3.8 failed
businesses before building a successful
one when you fail you're forced to tap
into your creativity what do I mean by
this well for example not many people
know this but YouTube was originally a
failed dating site the initial idea was
that people would record and upload
videos of themselves talking about the
partner of their dreams but it was so
unpopular that the guys who came up with
the idea couldn't even pay people to
stay on the platform this huge failure
forced them to go back to the drawing
board and tap into their creativity
eventually they landed on the idea that
they could remove the limitation and let
users upload videos on whatever they
wanted and thus the YouTube we know and
love today was born it was this large
painful failure that forced the founders
to think of a creative solution to turn
things around failure is an inherent
part of life everyone encounters it at
some point whilst some failures are
merely minor obstacles others can lead
to significant consequences however when
it comes to Online safety failure is not
an option that's where today's sponsor

you're doing enough to protect yourself

Embrace failure realize that failure is

I'll leave you with a great quote from
Tony Robbins when you succeed you party
